with_user_count.description: include number of users subscribed to each event

channel_id.description: the channel id of the scheduled event.

entity_metadata.description: the entity metadata of the scheduled event

name.description: the name of the scheduled event

privacy_level.description: the privacy level of the scheduled event

scheduled_start_time.description: the time to schedule the scheduled event

scheduled_end_time.description: the time when the scheduled event is scheduled to end

description.description: the description of the scheduled event

entity_type.description: the entity type of the scheduled event

image.description: the cover image of the scheduled event

with_user_count.description: include number of users subscribed to this event

channel_id.description: the channel id of the scheduled event, set to null if changing entity type to EXTERNAL

entity_metadata.description: the entity metadata of the scheduled event

name.description: the name of the scheduled event

privacy_level.description: the privacy level of the scheduled event

scheduled_start_time.description: the time to schedule the scheduled event

scheduled_end_time.description: the time when the scheduled event is scheduled to end

description.description: the description of the scheduled event

entity_type.description: the entity type of the scheduled event

status.description: the status of the scheduled event

image.description: the cover image of the scheduled event

limit.description: number of users to return (up to maximum 100)

with_member.description: include guild member data if it exists

before.description: consider only users before given user id
before.note-field: Provide a user id to before and after for pagination. Users will always be returned in ascending order by user_id. If both before and after are provided, only before is respected. Fetching users in-between before and after is not supported.

after.description: consider only users after given user id
after.note-field: Provide a user id to before and after for pagination. Users will always be returned in ascending order by user_id. If both before and after are provided, only before is respected. Fetching users in-between before and after is not supported.
